channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rep. Haley Stevens enters U.S. Senate race to represent Michigan
item.description: Fourth-term U.S. Rep. Haley Stevens has launched her run for Michigan's open U.S. Senate seat on Tuesday with a video focused on the economic crisis c...

item.title: Minneapolis DA will not pursue criminal charges against suspected Tesla vandal
item.description: The Minneapolis district attorney will not pursue criminal charges against a Minnesota state employee accused of vandalizing at least six Teslas.

item.title: ESPN host Shannon Sharpe will continue his on-air duties despite getting hit with $50 million lawsuit accusing him of rape
item.description: Sharpe is accused of verbal abuse, violence, making threats, and recording sexual encounters without consent.

item.title: U.S. Bank shares tribute on earnings call to executive Terry Dolan who died in Minnesota plane crash
item.description: Dolan was remembered as an "outstanding businessman and wonderful person."

item.title: Uber is launching a shuttle bus service at the Atlanta airport
item.description: Expansion follows successful roll-out in NYC.

item.title: GOP lawmaker touts $19M Trump tariff success story in her district: 'New model for American manufacturing'

item.title: Let Parents Protect Their Kids from Gender Ideology in Public Schools
item.description: The Supreme Court should affirm the right of parents in Montgomery County, Md., to opt out of radical teaching on gender.

item.title: It’s Time to Hold International Organizations Accountable for Supporting Terrorism
item.description: Sovereign countries can be sued for providing such aid. Institutions such as UNRWA should be no different.

item.title: The Courts Are The Scofflaws Behind Our Current Constitutional Crisis
item.description: The Supreme Court’s double standard suggests it is not prudence dictating the outcome. It is also not the Constitution.

item.title: Abrego Garcia Gamed the System
item.description: He shouldn’t be in a prison in El Salvador, but he also never should have escaped deportation for so long.

item.title: We Need a New and Improved Environmentalism
item.description: This Earth Day, let’s commit to an environmentalism that works for America, not against it.

item.title: RFK Jr.’s Quest To Discover Autism Causes Will Help Restore Americans’ Trust In Science
item.description: Not only does science need to be correct to be effective, but it also needs to be perceived to be correct.

item.title: Noem, DHS outline next step to speed up deportation process

item.title: Trump’s War on the Fed
item.description: Politician-driven monetary policy has a long record of failure.

item.title: Expensive WI Supreme Court Seat Already Paying Off For Wealthy Leftist Donors
item.description: The cemented left-led court has upheld Democrat Gov. Tony Evers’ veto trick to increase public school funding for the next four centuries.

item.title: Al Gore compares Trump admin to Hitler's Third Reich

item.title: Some Maryland parents want the Supreme Court to let them pull their kids from elementary school classes if story time features gay characters
item.description: Montgomery County public schools introduced the storybooks as part of an effort to better reflect the district's diverse population.

item.title: Florida protester screams at Rep. Byron Donalds during tense town hall
item.description: A protester was seen on video yelling at Rep. Byron Donalds and being escorted away by security during a town hall hosted by the Florida Republican.

item.title: Art Shouldn’t Get A Free Nudity Pass Just Because It’s Art
item.description: The fact that celebrated works from the past contain nudity doesn’t justify us including it in our films, literature, and other mediums.

item.title: As Big Oil producers start exploring again, the Gulf of Mexico is making a comeback with new projects from Chevron, Shell and BP
item.description: New technologies and cost savings are unlocking Big Oil projects in the Gulf

item.title: Book Review: Quantitative Risk and Portfolio Management: Theory and Practice
item.description: This book fills a unique gap between the CFA curriculum and the growing demand to find model-driven investment management solutions.
